info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 6 at 4:09PM MDT until September 6 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
FFWEPZ
The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... The Seven Springs Fire Burn Scar in... North Central Otero County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 630 PM MDT.
* At 409 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Seven Springs Fire Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Seven Springs Fire Burn Scar and downstream through Nogal Canyon. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Seven Springs Fire Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Seven Springs Fire Burn Scar.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Upper Nogal Canyon.
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Seven Springs Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
